posts.name: Brayden Durocher
posts.cooked: I tried to deploy code to the roboRio, but the error I got was: PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: ‘C:\Users\frc96\NTUSER.DAT’ Please help

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
That sounds like a Windows issue with the user profile.  Most of the search results for that error I find online talk about either creating a new user or doing a Windows Repair install to fix it:

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/broken-security-permissions-for-ntuserdat/b7b18703-19eb-4f1a-8e7e-dfbde50b887a

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/access-denied-to-ntuserdat-file/4d20916f-2077-43c5-9353-99f3f21a57c2

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
If I were to guess, you are running robotpy deploy directly from your user directory? Don’t do that.

When you open a terminal to run robotpy deploy , you need to change directory to the directory that your code is located in. It will only work properly if the current directory is the directory that robot.py is located in. If you happened to put robot.py in your home directory, make a new folder somewhere and put the code there instead.

posts.name: Brayden Durocher
posts.cooked: I did everything in that, the radio is broadcasting an access point, but it is not transmitting any data to the driver station.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: Try and ping the roborio. It should be at 10.xx.xx.2

posts.name: Brayden Durocher
posts.cooked: How do you ping the roboRio?

Open a terminal and type ping 10.xx.xx.2 and hit Enter. Replace the xx.xx with your team number, in your case, 10.96.99.2

(while connected to the radio wifi)

posts.name: Brayden Durocher
posts.cooked:
So, when I try to deploy code to the roboRio, this is the output: Screenshot 2025-03-11 173556 1453×608 21.2 KB I don’t know what to do, please help!

Screenshot 2025-03-11 173556 1453×608 21.2 KB

Screenshot 2025-03-11 173556 1453×608 21.2 KB

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
That error is it trying to load pyproject.toml, and there’s an unclosed array in that file at line 32, column 5.  You need to edit that file to fix the syntax error.

The error message isn’t great in that it doesn’t tell you what file it’s reading.

posts.name: Brayden Durocher
posts.cooked: You may think I’m dumb, but what is an array?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
An array is a list of multiple elements.  For the syntax of it in toml, see TOML: English v1.0.0

You’ll need to add a right square bracket (“]”) to close the array.
